abstract: Another set of weak economic data out of China showed that fixed-asset investment slowed, industrial production grew less than projected and retail sales growth was driven almost entirely by consumers taking advantage of the drop in gold prices.
snippet: Another set of weak economic data out of China showed that fixed-asset investment slowed, industrial production grew less than projected and retail sales growth was driven almost entirely by consumers taking advantage of the drop in gold prices.
lead_paragraph: Another week, another set of weak economic data out of China. Fixed-asset investment slowed and industrial production grew less than projected. And while retail sales growth met expectations, it was driven almost entirely by a 72.2 percent increase in jewelry purchases, apparently by consumers taking advantage of the drop in gold prices.

headline.main: As China’s Economy Stumbles, Government Eyes Reform
